description: Took in consideration a comment on the previous revision, and yeah. I think I exaggerated the accents because that's the way I heard them on the original song, but actually they're not that loud. Hope this works better.
title: Come As You Are

description:
Drums again, yeah.
1. Corrected the sound/volume on the pre-chorus fill.
1. Corrected choruses hi-hats' volume. You can hear Dave playing them on eight notes, but some of them hear pretty low. That's why I thought they were on quarters instead.
3. Deleted extra ghost notes that ain't present on the song. I'm pretty sure it has less than it seems. Sounds ironic, but ghost notes on this song are pretty listeneable.
4. On interlude, I'm sure Dave plays crash cymbals on quarters, but maybe it happens something similar to the choruses' hi-hats, I don't know.

Thx for reading (If you did)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZizFGj6zaxk
(A link to isolated drum track, if you want to check it yourselves.)
title: Come As You Are

description:
- Made drums readable
- Lowered vocals to the correct octave
- Vocal track is now tuned like the guitars (though I was pleased that they were tuned appropriately for a downtuned violin)
- Raised bass volume
- Removed power chord vibratos in the distortion guitar track
- Fixed the lyrics
- I lost the "V" upstroke notation that was in the previous tab (due to lack of support in TuxGuitar). I replaced it upstroke notation usually seen as a strum pattern.
title: Come As You Are
